actor_awards.notes: Jaffe won the Volpi Cup for Best Actor at the Venice Film Festival for 'The Asphalt Jungle' (1950). He was blacklisted in Hollywood during the 1950s, which interrupted his film career until his return in 'Ben-Hur'.

filmography.title: The Asphalt Jungle
filmography.role_description: A criminal mastermind who meticulously plans a jewel heist immediately after his release from prison, driven by a desire for one last big score and a weakness for young girls.
filmography.plot: A major jewel heist is planned and executed by a group of criminal specialists, but the scheme falls apart due to bad luck and double crosses.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Best Actor; Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor; National Film Registry: Inducted (2008)

filmography.title: Gunga Din
filmography.role_description: A loyal, courageous Indian water bearer who dreams of becoming a soldier in the British army and ultimately sacrifices himself to save the regiment.
filmography.plot: Three British sergeants and their native water bearer fight the Thuggee murder cult in colonial India.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (1999); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Cheers (#74)

filmography.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
filmography.role_description: A brilliant, Einstein-like physicist who is the only human reasonable enough to listen to the alien visitor Klaatu and help him deliver his message to the world.
filmography.plot: An alien lands on Earth and tells the people of the world that they must live peacefully or be destroyed as a danger to other planets.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (1995); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Thrills (#82)

filmography.title: Ben-Hur
filmography.role_description: The loyal and wise steward of the House of Hur who is crippled by Roman torture but remains steadfast in his devotion to Judah Ben-Hur.
filmography.plot: A Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, but he regains his freedom and returns for revenge.
filmography.awards: Film won 11 Oscars including Best Picture; National Film Registry: Inducted (2004)

filmography.title: Lost Horizon
filmography.role_description: The ancient, philosophical founder of Shangri-La who imparts the secrets of the utopia to the protagonist before his death.
filmography.plot: A plane crash delivers a group of people to the secluded land of Shangri-La, but is it a paradise or a prison?

filmography.title: The Scarlet Empress
filmography.role_description: The mad, imbecilic husband of Catherine the Great, whose unstable behavior forces her to take control of the throne.
filmography.plot: A young German princess marries the half-wit heir to the Russian throne and rises to become Catherine the Great.

filmography.title: Bedknobs and Broomsticks
filmography.role_description: A mysterious, somewhat sinister antique book dealer who holds the key to the 'Substitutiary Locomotion' spell sought by the protagonists.
filmography.plot: An apprentice witch, three kids, and a cynical magician search for the missing component to a magic spell to use in the defense of Britain in WWII.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: Gentleman's Agreement
filmography.role_description: A Jewish scientist and Einstein-like figure who provides a perspective on anti-Semitism at a dinner party.
filmography.plot: A reporter pretends to be Jewish in order to cover a story on anti-Semitism, and personally discovers the true depths of bigotry and hatred.

filmography.title: The Dunwich Horror
filmography.role_description: The eccentric, occult-practicing grandfather of Wilbur Whateley who guards the dark family secret in the attic.
filmography.plot: A young student is drawn into a plot to use the Necronomicon to summon the 'Old Ones' into our world.

filmography.title: 13 Rue Madeleine
filmography.role_description: The courageous French mayor who assists Allied agents in their mission against the Gestapo.
filmography.plot: An O.S.S. agent goes to France to locate a German missile site and uncover a double agent within his own team.

filmography.title: Rope of Sand
filmography.role_description: A philosophical, somewhat cynical doctor residing in a diamond-mining town in South West Africa.
filmography.plot: A man returns to a diamond-rich area to claim a hidden stash of gems, facing off against a sadistic police chief.

filmography.title: Battle Beyond the Stars
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but eccentric scientist living as a disembodied head in a jar on a space station, who offers his daughter to the hero.
filmography.plot: A young farmer recruits a group of diverse mercenaries to defend his peaceful planet from a tyrannical warlord.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nominated – Best Science Fiction Film

filmography.title: Guns for San Sebastian
filmography.role_description: A kindly old priest who shelters the protagonist and whose identity is later assumed by him.
filmography.plot: An outlaw on the run is mistaken for a priest and ends up helping a village defend itself against Yaqui Indians.

filmography.title: The Accused
filmography.role_description: A scientist and forensic expert who assists in the investigation of a student's death.
filmography.plot: A psychology professor accidentally kills a student in self-defense and tries to cover it up, but a police detective closes in.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nominated – Grand Prize

filmography.title: Under the Gun
filmography.role_description: A fellow prisoner who becomes a victim of the ruthless protagonist's scheme to secure a pardon.
filmography.plot: A racketeer sent to a prison farm plots his escape by manipulating the trustee system, which rewards prisoners for shooting escapees.

filmography.title: I Can Get It for You Wholesale
filmography.role_description: The loyal and ethical business partner of a ruthless fashion designer, serving as her moral compass.
filmography.plot: An ambitious fashion designer steps on everyone in her way to reach the top, including her partners and friends.

filmography.title: The Barbarian and the Geisha
filmography.role_description: The Dutch-American interpreter and secretary to Townsend Harris, helping him navigate Japanese culture.
filmography.plot: The first U.S. Consul General to Japan faces hostility and cultural barriers but finds an ally in a geisha.

filmography.title: Night Gallery (Pilot)
filmography.role_description: A concentration camp survivor who recognizes a fugitive Nazi war criminal in a South American museum.
filmography.plot: A collection of three supernatural tales, including one about a Nazi hiding in South America who is haunted by his past.

filmography.title: The Great Bank Robbery
filmography.role_description: An art forger who poses as a monk to help a fake reverend rob a bank.
filmography.plot: A group of criminals posing as church leaders plots to rob a bank in a Western town, facing competition from other gangs.

filmography.title: We Live Again
filmography.role_description: A political prisoner who offers the protagonist a chance at a new life and redemption.
filmography.plot: A Russian nobleman seeks redemption for ruining a peasant girl's life by following her into exile in Siberia.

filmography.title: A Guide for the Married Man
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as a psychiatrist in a vignette illustrating the perils of infidelity.
filmography.plot: A faithful husband is given lessons in the art of adultery by his more experienced friend and neighbor.

filmography.title: Nothing Lasts Forever
filmography.role_description: The mystical, ancient spirit of New York City who guides the protagonist on his journey.
filmography.plot: An artist fails a test and is forced to direct traffic in the Holland Tunnel, leading him on a surreal journey to the moon.

filmography.title: Columbo: Forgotten Lady
filmography.role_description: The wealthy, retired physician husband of a fading movie star who becomes the victim of her desperate comeback attempt.
filmography.plot: An aging film star kills her husband when he refuses to finance her comeback, but her fading memory complicates the investigation.

filmography.title: The Old Man Who Cried Wolf
filmography.role_description: An elderly man who witnesses a murder but cannot get anyone to believe him because of his history of telling tall tales.
filmography.plot: An old man witnesses a gangland killing, but no one believes him except the killers, who are now out to silence him.

filmography.title: The Tell-Tale Heart
filmography.role_description: The victim in Edgar Allan Poe's classic tale, whose 'vulture eye' drives his caretaker to murder.
filmography.plot: A man is driven to madness and murder by the staring eye of the old man he cares for.
